document.docAuthor: Ko, Hyun Sook & Clark, Paul F.
document.masterDocTitle: The zoeal development of Nanocassiope granulipes (Sakai, 1939) (Crustacea: Decapoda: Brachyura: Xanthidae) described from laboratory-reared material

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The zoeal development of Nanocassiope granulipes (Sakai, 1939) (Crustacea: Decapoda: Brachyura: Xanthidae) described from laboratory-reared material

subSubSection.paragraph: (gures 1–13)

Size . Carapace length
0.46 Ô
0.03 mm. Distance from tip of dorsal spine to tip of rostral spine
1.50 Ô
0.03 mm.

Carapace (gure 1a). Dorsal spine long, distally curved and spinulate and longer than rostral spine; rostral spine straight with three small spines distally and shorter than antennal protopod; lateral spines present and short; anterodorsal setae absent; one pair of posterodorsal setae present; each ventral margin without setae; eyes sessile.
Antennule (gure 4a). Uniramous; endopod absent; exopod unsegmented with three long (two stout1 one thinner) aesthetascs, one short, slender aesthetasc and one small seta, all terminal.
Antenna (gure 5a, b). Protopod longer than rostral spine and distally spinulate; with a minute protopodal spine; exopod ca 12% length of protopod with one short terminal seta.
Mandible . Asymmetrical; right molar with two teeth and left molar with one tooth, con uent with incisor process; endopod palp absent.

Maxillule (gure 6a). Coxal epipod absent, endite with seven terminal setae; basial endite with ve setal processes; endopod two-segmented, proximal segment with one seta, distal segment with six (two subterminal1 four terminal) setae; exopod seta absent.

Maxilla (gure 7a). Coxal endite bilobed with 41 4 setae; basial endite bilobed with 51 4 setae; endopod bilobed with 31 5 (two subterminal1 three terminal) setae; exopod (scaphognathite) margin with four plumose setae plus distal stout process.

First maxilliped (gure 8a). Coxa with one seta; basis with 10 setae arranged 2, 2, 3, 3; endopod ve-segmented with 3, 2, 1, 2, 5 (one subterminal1 four terminal) setae, respectively; exopod two-segmented, distal segment with four terminal natatory plumose setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 1.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Anterior view of carapace: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Second maxilliped (gure 9a). Coxa without seta; basis with four setae; endopod three-segmented, with 1, 1, 5 (two subterminal1 three terminal) setae, respectively; exopod two-segmented, distal segment with four terminal natatory plumose setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 2.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Anterior view of carapace: (a) third zoea; (b) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Third maxilliped . Absent.
Pereiopods . Absent.

Abdomen (gures 11a, 12a). Five somites; somite 2 with a pair of lateral processes directed laterally; somite 3 with a pair of lateral processes directed posteriorly; somites 3–5 with posterolateral processes; somites 2–5 with one pair of posterodorsa l setae; pleopods absent.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 3.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Chaetotaxy of ventral carapace margin: (a) second zoea; (b) third zoea; (c) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Telson (gures 11a, 12a, 13a). Each fork long and not spinulate, with one stout lateral spine, one minute lateral seta and one stout dorsomedial spine; posterior margin with three pairs of stout spinulate setae.

Size . Carapace length
0.52 Ô
0.05 mm. Distance from tip of dorsal spine to tip of rostral spine
1.68 Ô
0.09 mm.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 4.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Antennule: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea; (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Carapace (gures 1b, 3a). Dorsal spine with one pair of setae proximally; two pairs of anterodorsal setae present; each ventral margin with one plumose anterior seta; eyes stalked; otherwise unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 5.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Antenna: (a) rst zoea; (c) second zoea; (e) third zoea; (g) fourth zoea. Antennal exopod: (b) rst zoea; (d) second zoea; (f) third zoea; (h) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Antennule (gure 4b). Exopod now with ve long (three stout1 two thinner) aesthetascs, otherwise unchanged.
Antenna (gure 5c, d). Minute protopodal spine now absent; exopod now ca 4% length of protopod; otherwise unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 6.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Maxillule: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea; (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Mandible . Unchanged.
Maxillule (gure 6b). Basial endite with eight setal processes; exopod plumose seta now present; otherwise unchanged.
Maxilla (gure 7b). Exopod (scaphognathite) margin with 11 plumose setae and distal, stout process no longer prominent; otherwise unchanged.
First maxilliped (gure 8b). Exopod distal segment now with six terminal natatory plumose setae; otherwise unchanged.
Second maxilliped (gure 9b). Exopod distal segment now with seven terminal natatory plumose setae; otherwise unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 7.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Maxilla: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea; (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Third maxilliped . Developing.
Pereiopods . Developing.
Abdomen (gures 11b, 12b). Somites 3–5 with longer posterolateral processes; otherwise unchanged.
Telson (gures 11b, 12b, 13b). Unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 8.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. First maxilliped: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea; (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Size . Carapace length
0.80 Ô
0.02 mm. Distance from tip of dorsal spine to tip of rostral spine
2.54 Ô
0.09 mm.

Carapace (gures 2a, 3b). Dorsal spine now with two pairs of setae proximally; ve pairs of anterodorsal setae; each ventral margin with one plumose anterior seta plus ve posterior setae; otherwise unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 9.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Second maxilliped: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea; (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Antennule (gure 4c). Exopod now with one subterminal aesthetasc; otherwise unchanged.
Antenna (gure 5e, f). Endopod bud present; otherwise unchanged.
Mandible . Unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 10.
Nanocassiope granulipe s
( Sakai, 1939 ). Third maxilliped: (a) third zoea; (b) fourth zoea; Pereiopods (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea. Mandible showing palp: (e) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Maxillule (gure 6c). Coxal endite now with eight terminal setae; basial endite with nine setal processes; otherwise unchanged.
Maxilla (gure 7c). Coxal endite bilobed now with 51 4 setae; basial endite bilobed with 51 5 setae; exopod (scaphognathite) margin with 19 plumose setae; otherwise unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 11.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Dorsal view of abdomen: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea; (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: First maxilliped (gure 8c). Coxa with epipod bud present; endopod terminal segment with six (two subterminal1 four terminal) setae; exopod distal segment now with eight terminal natatory plumose setae; otherwise unchanged.
Second maxilliped (gure 9c). Exopod distal segment now with nine terminal natatory plumose setae; otherwise unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 12.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Lateral view of abdomen: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea; (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Third maxilliped (gure 10a). Biramous; endopod longer than exopod.
Pereiopods (gure 10c). Rudimentary, undiVerentiated into segments; cheliped bilobed.

Abdomen (gures 11c, 12c). Now with six somites; somite 1 with one pair of dorsomedial setae; somites 3–5 with slightly longer posterolateral processes; pleopod buds present but without endopod buds; otherwise unchanged.

caption.paragraph:
FIG. 13.
Nanocassiope granulipes ( Sakai, 1939 )
. Dorsal view of telson: (a) rst zoea; (b) second zoea; (c) third zoea; (d) fourth zoea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Telson (gures 11c, 12c, 13c). Posterior margin with three pairs of stout spinulate setae plus one pair of small setae; otherwise unchanged.

Size . Carapace length
1.13 Ô
0.04 mm. Distance from tip of dorsal spine to tip of rostral spine
2.92 Ô
0.12 mm.
Carapace (gures 2b, 3c). Seven pairs of anterodorsal setae; each ventral margin with one plumose anterior seta plus eight posterior setae; otherwise unchanged.

Antennule (gure 4d). Biramous; endopod bud present; exopod with four rows of subterminal aesthetascs arranged 2, 4, 2, 1 and in the terminal position, ve long (three stout1 two slender), one short slender aesthetasc and one small seta.
Antenna (gures 5g , h). Endopod developing; otherwise unchanged.
Mandible (gure 10e). Endopod palp present.
Maxillule (gure 6d). Coxal epipod seta now present; endite now with 11 terminal setae; basial endite with 13 setal processes; otherwise unchanged.
Maxilla (gure 7d). Coxal endite bilobed now with 61 4 setae; basial endite bilobed with 61 7 setae; exopod (scaphognathite) margin with 29 plumose setae; otherwise unchanged.
First maxilliped (gure 8d). Coxa with epipod bud more developed and now with two setae; exopod distal segment now with nine terminal natatory plumose setae; otherwise unchanged.
Second maxilliped (gure 9d). Exopod distal segment now with 11 terminal natatory plumose setae; otherwise unchanged.
Third maxilliped (gure 10b). Epipod now present; arthrobranch gill present; endopod and exopod developing.
Pereiopods (gure 10d). Some segmental diVerentiation into segments.
Abdomen (gures 11d, 12d). Somite 1 with three dorsal medial setae; somites 3–5 with slightly longer posterolateral processes; pleopods 1–4 with endopod buds; otherwise unchanged.
Telson (gures 11d, 12d, 13d). Dorsal medial surface with one pair of setae; posterior margin with three pairs of stout spinulate setae plus two pairs of small setae; otherwise unchanged.
